intro: Peucedanum minus, commonly known as lesser cow parsley, is a biennial or perennial herb native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassy areas. Its fruits are small, dry, and ribbed, containing two seeds each. The plant is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments and is part of the Apiaceae (carrot) family.
